content: In the U.S. market, we saw an improvement in client quality at the first month average net asset inflow of new paying clients increased by approximately 40% sequentially. Total client assets in wealth management grew 68% year-over-year and 22% quarter-over-quarter to HKD32 billion, mainly driven by sustained interest in money market funds amid interest rate hikes. Net income margin expanded to 42% in the fourth quarter as compared to 31% in the same quarter last year, mainly due to lower marketing spending. And looking ahead, we see a lot of room for growth in wealth management business, and we plan to continuously diversify structured products in Hong Kong with an aim to provide five types of notes, including fixed dividend structured products and fund linked notes in the first half of this year to better maybe asset allocation needs professional investors and high net worth clients. The second question regarding the interest income, it is very difficult to quantify how much idle cash we can utilize, but it depends on the market volatility, but I can give you some general range, say, in our history, the idle cash percentage-wise accounts for roughly 20% to 10% of our total client assets, different markets â different market conditions. So, in fourth quarter, the average net asset inflow of new paying clients for their first month of onboarding to increase by 40% quarter-over-quarter. And as mentioned, the first month average net asset inflows from our new paying clients in the U.S. increased by around 40%, mainly because we focused on attracting client assets and adjusted the reward threshold.
